1.text: The king’s heart is a waterway in the hand of the LORD; He directs it where He pleases.

2.text: All a man’s ways seem right to him, but the LORD weighs the heart.

3.text: To do righteousness and justice is more desirable to the LORD than sacrifice.

4.text: Haughty eyes and a proud heart—the guides of the wicked—are sin.

5.text: The plans of the diligent bring plenty, as surely as haste leads to poverty.

6.text: Making a fortune by a lying tongue is a vanishing mist, a deadly pursuit.

7.text: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away because they refuse to do what is just.

8.text: The way of a guilty man is crooked, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.

9.text: Better to live on a corner of the roof than to share a house with a quarrelsome wife.

10.text: The soul of the wicked man craves evil; his neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.

11.text: When a mocker is punished, the simple gain wisdom; and when a wise man is instructed, he acquires knowledge.

12.text: The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked and brings the wicked to ruin.

13.text: Whoever shuts his ears to the cry of the poor, he too shall cry out and receive no answer.

14.text: A gift in secret soothes anger, and a covert bribe pacifies great wrath.

15.text: Justice executed is a joy to the righteous, but a terror to the workers of iniquity.

16.text: The man who strays from the path of understanding will rest in the assembly of the dead.

17.text: He who loves pleasure will become poor; the one who loves wine and oil will never be rich.

18.text: The wicked become a ransom for the righteous, and the faithless for the upright.

19.text: Better to live in the desert than with a contentious and ill-tempered wife.

20.text: Precious treasures and oil are in the dwelling of the wise, but a foolish man consumes them.

21.text: He who pursues righteousness and loving devotion finds life, righteousness, and honor.

22.text: A wise man scales the city of the mighty and pulls down the stronghold in which they trust.

23.text: He who guards his mouth and tongue keeps his soul from distress.

24.text: Mocker is the name of the proud and arrogant man—of him who acts with excessive pride.

25.text: The craving of the slacker kills him because his hands refuse to work.

26.text: All day long he covets more, but the righteous give without restraint.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable—how much more so when brought with ill intent!

28.text: A lying witness will perish, but the man who listens to truth will speak forever.

29.text: A wicked man hardens his face, but the upright man makes his way sure.

30.text: There is no wisdom, no understanding, no counsel that can prevail against the LORD.

31.text: A horse is prepared for the day of battle, but victory is of the LORD.
